text: p.s. sorry for the typos - my cat broke my keyboard. =/

Yeah I was thinking of moving to the CLI for this reason. I've used it for find & replace and such but haven't used it extensively yet. We'll just need to switch up our internal workflow a little I suppose.

I’m working on a redesign in Content Staging, but it looks like a bunch of styles are being overwritten and JS is being blocked because of the current CSS and JS files that were added globally in Settings. What’s the best way to exclude these files in the new theme without having to add the current CSS/JS files to every live page/template?
Set seperate rules and CSS/JS files in the Website > pages-settings for the sandbox domain.

Hi every one, I'm new on HubSpot, I did the basic tutorial on the academy,
 and I had an important question, there is a way to have different
environment that the "production"? i mean if I can have running
different version with the same account  like develop environment, testing environment and production?. thanks in advance

Hi everyone, I'm working on the rss_listing part, but seems like no matter what external url I set( like using {% rss_listing "terms" rss_url='<http://blog.HubSpot.com/marketing/rss.xml>', feed_source={rss_url='<http://blog.HubSpot.com/marketing/rss.xml>', is_external=True}, title='Terms to Know', show_date=False, show_author=False, number_of_items='5', limit_to_chars='200' %}), it will still display my default rss listing, not the external one I set, I don't know how to make that :disappointed:
There's is some pretty new and fresh ways to do this. check out <#CLJJXGTC0|local-development>

They way I'm doing (and the way I think HubSpot recommends) is to setup a free sandbox account as your "develop" or testing, then push the code over to production portal then build pages in there and stage for content review
thanks! Douglas, this is exatly what I need it
